channel.title: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!
channel.description: Hey its Donkie, I know a little about Private Servers, but I'm [u]NOT[/u] good with Clients, So... whenever i download a client that looks REALLY good, it always comes up with this error! ALL THE TIME! heres a picture of the error. PLEASE HELP ANYTHING WOULD BE HELPFUL. I have latest java, [IMG]http://i389.photobucket.com/albums/oo336/doodoohead395/javapic.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i389.photobucket.com/albums/oo336/doodoohead395/error123.jpg[/img]

item.title: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Donkie Owner Donkie
item.description:
@Owner_Donkie wrote:

Alright im not good with this stuff.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 11, 2008, 07:48:44 pm[/size][hr]Anyone help?

Read full topic

item.title: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Donkie Owner Donkie
item.description:
@Owner_Donkie wrote:

Ok, there was no compiler, so i added one and compiled and it added some files? Then i added the stuff back into the run, now when i try to run it goes back to the EGUI, not the client…

Read full topic
item.source: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!

item.title: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

The class that was searched for, in this case EGUI existed when it was compiled, but it cannot be found anymore. Try compiling the client and then change the run.bat code back to;

@echo off echo XscapeScape Client echo Edited by Extermilator JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI

Read full topic
item.source: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!

item.title: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!

@Owner_Donkie wrote:

Err… What lol? Sorry im not good with this stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!

item.title: Urgh! Help with this dumb error!
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Solution;
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/NoClassDefFoundError.html
In other words;
The searched-for class definition existed when the currently executing class was compiled, but the definition can no longer be found.

Read full topic
